page.title: 15BIRTH, MARRIAGE AND DEATH
page.content: Lismore children are now{born}in{Oban {Maternity Home,}or the{Vale of Leven Hospital.{District Nurses}must still have{maternity training}in case of an island birth. Many babies are{baptised in{church}and all are{welcomed}into the community with many{gifts. { Weddings}are mostly held in{Oban {churches}because a{big hotel}is{needed for the{reception _}for{the meal}and {drink}and{dancing,}and to put people up for the{night.}What ceilidhs before and after the band has gone home! There have been grievous and untimely {deaths}in Lismore in{1985,}with enough mourners at{funerals}to fill the church and gallery, or to stand in{the {open outside a house}for the service and then to follow to the{graveyard. There the{relatives}and{neighbours, with their{numbered cords,}lower the {coffin}and flowers are piled high.
